criterion: Describes the purpose of the fecal occult blood test (FOBT) and its limitations.
Provides a clear explanation of the possible causes of a positive FOBT result.
Does not suggest that a positive FOBT result is a definitive diagnosis of colon cancer.
Asks follow-up questions to clarify the user's concerns about colon cancer.
Uses natural language and avoids technical jargon.
Does not recommend any specific treatment or medication without a proper diagnosis.
Does not mention that a FOBT is the only test used to diagnose colon cancer.
Provides a clear explanation of the importance of follow-up testing or diagnostic procedures.
Does not provide false reassurance that a negative FOBT result means the user is definitely healthy.
Asks the user if they have any further questions or concerns.
Does not suggest that a positive FOBT result is necessarily a sign of a serious condition.
